title: Women on Universal credit left selling sex for £5 to survive due to five-week wait
text:

Women on Universal Credit have been left so desperate that they're selling sex for just £5.

MPs have been warned that women are turning to prostitution to survive due to the five-week wait for the benefits to be paid.

A government inquiry by the work and pensions committee has found a "fundamental design flaw" in the system.

The committee is now urging the government to remove the five-week wait at the be ginning of their claim.

One woman affected by Universal Credit told Sky News she is contemplating going back on the streets.

She said: "In the last six months my life has gone down the drain.

(Image: Getty Images/iStockphoto)

(Image: Getty Images/iStockphoto)

"I had got out of prostitution. I got help to apply for benefits and was just about managing, then I was moved over to Universal Credit.

"I got less money but I was still managing, then I got a letter in the post saying that I was no longer entitled to Universal Credit because I was an EU citizen and I had to apply for settled status."

She added that it was impossible to live with no money, and she felt she had no choice but to sell herself.
description: MPs have been warned that the five-week for Universal Credit is a "fundamental design flaw"
